newsitem.title: GERMANY: Germany's Karstadt to cut number of stores - paper.
newsitem.headline: Germany's Karstadt to cut number of stores - paper.

text.p: The German department store group Karstadt AG said on Saturday it planned to cut the number of its stores in Germany to 215 from 233 as part of a strategy to break even in 1997.
Most of the 18 stores affected will be in the group's Hertie chain, the group said in the Saturday edition of Die Welt newspaper. The company repeated its target was to break even this year.

Last month Karstadt said sluggish German economic growth in 1996 had hit operations, but it did not detail earnings figures. The group said in November that 1996 earnings would not match the 109 million marks achieved in the previous year.
The group said the planned integration of its Hertie and Karstadt units would be finished by the end of 1997.
